fields.description:
I want my helpdesk team to be able to change fields "Reporter" from issue view.

Sometimes my helpdesk team creates tickets in behalf of customer, in that case we need to change the reporter.

Right now its only possible to do so if i select bulk edit under filters and change the reporter for one or more tickets but its too complicated. I want it to be possible under issue view.

!image-2021-07-27-15-16-07-736.png!
fields.summary: "Reporter" field is not editable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While linking a confluence space to a JSM project, the space name appears in the drop-down but quickly disappears after a second. This makes it impossible to link confluence space
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add more than 50 spaces on Confluence on the *same domain* as the JSM project.
 # Go to the JSM project settings -> Knowledge base -> Link Space
 # In the drop-down, you will see that a confluence space name appears and disappears within a minute

h3. Expected Results

The confluence space name appears and we can link it to the project
h3. Actual Results

Confluence Space appears and disappears within a second.
h3. Workaround

Contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] to apply the workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence space appears and disappears in a second in the dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For the 'Affected Services' field, the linked issues section does not show any linked issues -- also the relevant service on Insight does not show issues linked to the service/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a service in an ITSM project
 # Add the 'Affected Services' field to all screens for the project
 # Create a new issue, fill the 'Affected Services' field with the service
 # On the issue, go to the object details/graph view on the affected service
 # Click the "Linked issues" tab

h3. Expected Results

The linked issues section should show with the issue that has just been created.

h3. Actual Results

No linked issues being shown for the service

h3. Workaround

No workaround

 !image-2021-07-27-15-36-28-552.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-07-27-15-37-16-804.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Affected services not showing linked issues on the 'Linked issues' tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight Object linked issues section crashes if there are linked issues with no Priority field configured on them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type with the Priority field hidden, link it to the field configuration scheme for your project
 # Create an Insight Field with at least one object configured and link it to that issue type and all screens for the project
 # Create a new issue with that issue type, fill in that Insight field with an object
 # On the issue, go to the object details/graph view on the Insight object
 # Click the "Linked issues" tab

h3. Expected Results

The linked issues section should show, with the issue that has just been created.
h3. Actual Results

The object details modal disappears and an error flag is shown. Clicking the button on the Insight object to re-enter the object details modal doesn't do anything - the page needs to be refreshed to be able to re-enter the modal.
h3. Workaround

Edit the issue type configuration to include the Priority field for the issues which may have Insight fields/objects added to them.
fields.summary: Insight Object linked issues section crashes if there are linked issues with no Priority field

fields.description:
Object Types and Attributes with spaces need to be enclosed with straight quotes.

Sometimes when users copy information that contains quotes from other sources, the quotes come as curly quotes instead of straight quotes, preventing the search to work on the IQL query:

!2021-07-23 12_53_12-Edit - Report Catalogue - 2021 Zapproved Insight Asset Management - Oxalis Confl.png|id=cp-img!
fields.summary: Consider both straight and curly quotes while querying with IQL

fields.description: Actually is not possible to reuse past maintenance policies in Opsgenie, which requires Admins to recreate big maintenances policies each time a new one is required.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to have the ability to use past maintenance policies as a template for the next ones

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Not able to unlink assets when there are more than 20 assets linked to an issue:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an asset field and add it to the issue screen
# Create an issue with more than 20 assets linked
# Try to unlink an issue using the Edit issue action

h3. Expected Results
Able to unlink the assets

h3. Actual Results
Not able to unlink assets
{noformat}
Request URL: https://kahol.atlassian.net/secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa?decorator=none
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 400 

Response
errorMessages: ["We couldn't save your changes. Copy your content, then try reloading the page."]
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Due to the bug we cannot link more than 20 assets on the edit issue action: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9743

h3.Workaround
Reach out to support
fields.summary: Not able to unlink assets when there are more than 20 assets linked to an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an object schema is deleted the object schema first disappears and display a successful badge/popup then the same object schema reappears after a browser refresh. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a object schema
 # Create and configure a import (you don't even need to run it)
 # Try delete the created object schema
 # Refresh the browser

h3. Expected Results

The object schema is deleted
h3. Actual Results

A UnsupportedOperationException exception is thrown during the deletion
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Delete an object schema fails

fields.description:
Hello, 

${request.details} lists all the fields and their values in an email. This was available for Jira server but not in the Cloud version. 

It was very useful for people who wanted to approve of a request and didnt want to log into Jira to do so.
fields.summary: ${request.details} not available in customer notification email

fields.description: Need to be able to separate customers from agents in the Service desk portal.  They should be completely separate schemes to ensure no confusion in assigning users
fields.summary: Separate Customers from Agents

fields.description:
Hi my name is George and i work for Mageguide.

We have a team of 5 agents (including me) who use the Service Desk in order to collaborate with our customer's requests.

I am the leader of our Support team and many times I need to intervene in a request that a colleague has already answered in order to make things more clear for our customers and let them know what a specialist suggests for their request so to be solved.

Although from our customer's portal view it is not clear that a specialist (or a person from a lead position) responds to their request and i think that we can make it more visually clear for them.

I had this idea from Atlassian Community that you are already implemented something like this and i think it would be useful.

( for example with COMMUNITY LEADER BAGDE)
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/automatically-assign-a-new-issue-to-me/qaq-p/741971]

I hope my proposal is understandable and may it come true!

Best regards,
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk - Supervisor answer inside a ticket

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, after all the approvers approved the issue , in the ticket it display as below :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-23 at 1.10.12 pm.png|thumbnail! 

It will be great to change it to more "green" information instead of a warning

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great to change it to more "green" information instead of a warning. For example :-

{noformat}
All approver already approved
{noformat}

h3. Why this is important
To prevent confusion for the agents.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Change the completion approval information instead of "Add 0 more approvers"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when approval status requires more than 1 approvals , even when customer create issue only with 1 approver , it doesn't notify customer to add more approver based on the configuration. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to be able to set a validator based on Approval field value during issue creation . By doing so, issue creation will be fail if user doesn't meet number of approval needed.

h3. Why this is important
Approval field have the needed number of approvers based on the approval configuration.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to set validator for Approval field based on number of user added to the field

fields.description:
We are new to Jira. We just started with JSM cloud premium, and we are struggling to find any relevant information on how to start with integrated Insight version (due to its current limitations). I cannot find any information on the public facing roadmap about SCCM integration - an integration that should be logical for us since we are heavily using SCCM to manage our endpoints. I know this a top priority area, so why can't I find any information on this ?

As far as I know, another option would be to deploy Insight discovery agent on Windows devices, and then import reports to Insight; but again I cannot find any documentation on how to achieve this (I may be wrong, bt I believe documenttino is focused on the network scanner version of the tool, not the locally installed service version)

Another option could also be to develop custom integration using the newly developped REST API, but is it worth it ? I mean, we have the technical resources to do this, but what if SCCM integration is made available in the next coming months...

Could you please help me decide what is my best option to start with Insight in this context ?
fields.summary: Insight - Importing assets from SCCM

fields.description:
h3. eIssue Summary

If I have an Object Type that has no Objects, but does have subtypes, when I view that Object Type, the blue progress bar at the top of the screen never completes. If I click an Object Type that has an Object of that Object Type, the screen loads as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View All Object Schemas
 # Select and Object Schema
 # Click "Add Object Type"
 # Click newly added Object Type on left hand navigation

OR

    5. Click on Object Type that has objects

    6. Conduct an IQL search that returns no results (from the Object Type view)
h3. Expected Results

The blue progress bar loads and then disappears once the screen is loaded
h3. Actual Results

The blue progress bar nearly completes, but stalls out and remains on screen
h3. Workaround

There is no adverse effect caused by the failing progress bar. The functionality of the site is unimpeded. A preventive measure to avoid this behaviour is to ensure that the IQL search returns some results.
fields.summary: Viewing an Object Type or Search that has no Objects results in an infinitely loading blue progress bar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When working with a service project with no SLAs configured, issues are showing an empty panel in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Check the SLA panel by the right of the screen

h3. Expected Results

No SLA panel should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

An empty panel is exhibited:
 !https://p-25foddj.b0.n0.cdn.getcloudapp.com/items/v1uYwmKv/59caf55a-46de-4449-b171-b50bb8dfe5f2.jpg?v=51259094db13ea9d816a87db692de4a9!

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description: Currently, for the newly created Service Management projects by default, the Customer Permission setting is set to *Anyone on the web (without logging in)*. This raised security concerns from customer end-users. Some users who belong to an old user group claimed that there was a risk their ticket details were exposed to other user groups. It should be set to *Customers added by agents and admins* or there should be an option to change the default customer permissions.
fields.summary: Set default Customer Permission for newly created JSM projects

fields.description:
We've noticed an issue with incident rules and automatically associating alerts in OpsGenie with open incidents.

How use case is that tickets are created in Jira service management as incidents, and alerts in OpsGenie are then created for these incidents. We also have a rule to create these specific alerts as incidents.

We might have 2 completely separate Jira incidents open at the same time, but because they are going to OpsGenie with the same integration rule then they are being associated with the same OpsGenie incident (even if they are not related at all).

What would be nice is in the incident rules for a team, to be able to specify if content matches an already existing incident then associate them.

E.g. An incident is already open for a Jira ticket JIRA123. If Jira ticket JIRA125 is also an incident, it should be able to compare if the Jira tickets match. If they do, then associate them else create a new OpsGenie incident.
fields.summary: Compare alert details to associate or create new incident

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When flagging a Jira Service Management issue from a Kanban board it's possible to add an internal comment. However, the internal comment is actually added as a public comment even though there is a clear message saying "Your comments will not be visible to customers on the portal.".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Right-click on a Jira Service Management issue from a Kanban board.
 # Click *Add flag*.
 # Add a comment in the *Internal comment* tab.
 # Click *Add*.

h3. Expected Results
An internal comment is added to the issue and the comment is not visible on the customer portal.

h3. Actual Results
A public comment is added to the issue and is visible on the customer portal.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding an internal comment while flagging a JSM issue adds the comment as public

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment the only custom fields that can be used as placeholders are Insight custom fields and this feature would extend support for *standard* custom fields, like text fields
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In your Insight field configuration use an IQL that references a custom field that is not an Insight custom field, ie. SimpleTextCustomField - customfield_xxxxx

h3. Expected Results

Your search results reflect the values in that custom field. 
h3. Actual Results

You don't get any results. 
h3. Workaround

Set up an Insight field that mimics the value of that custom field, ie. an SimpleTextCustomField Insight field, and set that Insight field as the placeholder and also set up an Automation rule that populates that Insight field when the relevant custom field is changed.
fields.summary: Allow the use of other standard custom fields as placeholders in the filter issue scope IQL

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, if user create issue with attachment from Outlook , the attachment are not visible to Customer from Customer Portal. This also happen even though "Request Type" value been choose. 

h3. Suggestion
It will be best to automatically make the attachment visible at Customer Portal if user already select "Request type" value during issue creation.

h3. Workaround
Need to manually add the attachment as public comment
fields.summary: When issue created with attachment via Jira Cloud for Outlook apps , it automatically visible for customer to view from Customer Portal

fields.description:
Currently, you can't see descriptions of fields (that is set in request type setting page) in create issue screen in team-managed project. 
You can see them (that is set in issue type setting page) in JSW team-managed project. It is great to apply this behavior to JSM as well.
fields.summary: Ability to show a description of a field in create issue screen in team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you have only one request type created for your project, you must still select a request type when you are creating a ticket via the portal.
It would be nice to have the ability to skip the request type selection in the submit a ticket process when you have only one request type configured in your project.

h3. Workaround
There's no alternative solution at this moment.
fields.summary: Ability to skip the request type selection to create a ticket when you have only one request type configured

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The mandatory field error highlight is not working as expected for ITSM template fields like *Components, Affected versions*, etc on the customer portal. The error will be highlighted only once the *Summary* and ** *Description*** are entered.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add *Components* and/or *Affected versions* fields as required fields in the request form of the request type
 # Try to raise a new request from the portal without filling in the mandatory fields.

h3. Expected Results

Mandatory field error highlight should appear for all required fields of the request type
h3. Actual Results

The mandatory field error is highlighted only for the *Summary* and *Description* field and not for other ITSM mandatory fields.

!error.jpg|width=559,height=609!

 

Once the *Summary* and *Description* fields are filled in, then *Components* and *Affected* versions fields are highlighted for the error.

!RightlyHighlighted.jpg|width=410,height=484!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h3. Notes

The error is highlighted properly for other custom fields.
fields.summary: Mandatory field error highlight not working for ITSM template fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Navigating back just once after clicking a sub-task in the queue view of a ticket is not enough to back to the actual parent ticket.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new issue in a Service project;
 # Through a queue, access it. The URL should have the queue breadcrumbs (ie instance/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues/custom/1/PKEY-999);
 # Create a new sub-task for that ticket;
 # Click the sub-task box (but not it's actual key)
 # Navigate back on the browser

h3. Expected Results

You're returned to the parent ticket;

h3. Actual Results

You're left on the same sub-task.

*Notes* Checking the URL during the process you'll notice it changes *twice*:

# From the original ticket: instance/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues/custom/1/PKEY-999
# To an intermediate state: instance/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues/custom/1/PKEY-999?selectedIssue=PKEY-1000
# Then to the subtask: instance/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues/custom/1/PKEY-1000?selectedIssue=PKEY-1000

This intermediate state will display inconsistent data, such as the sub-task summary while listing the parent's childs.

h3. Workaround

* navigate back again;
* open subtask by clicking the sub-task key as you're directed to it's instance/browse/PKEY-0000 URL without queue breadcrumbs
fields.summary: Navigating back just once after clicking a sub-task in the queue view of a ticket is not enough to back to the actual parent ticket.

fields.description: Currently, even if you remove all SLAs from the project, the SLA section will still show in the issue view, therefore, it would be great to add an option to remove the SLA group from the issue view, as there are customers that do not use this feature.
fields.summary: Add option to hide/remove SLA from the issue view
Automation date and time functions do not work on the Insight object date, dateTime attributes

fields.description:
Hi , 

for anyone transitioning from Zendesk to JSM this is a missing feature that creates many problems internally. 

We need the ability to put anyone (even non-registered Jira users) as request participants. Something like "CC" fields in emails, so they start getting notifications on tickets. 

The reason behind this is that there are certain groups of people within customer organizations that need to be in the loop on one specific issue but all of them are, for instance, members of the one email distribution list. Thus the need to send email updates to these distribution lists or persons without any restrictions. 

Zendesk introduced this a year ago and it was a real hit. You should think about it too. Ty
fields.summary: Adding the "external watchers" or "CC" field if you will

fields.description:
It would be good to have a way to highlight rows that are nearing SLA breach.
I am currently using GreaseMonkey\JavaScript to do this but I'd rather do it natively so that I can expand to the other teams.

For me, i have 2 rules.
1. Go from neutral to red depending on how close it gets to breach of SLA (i only go through red but it would be better if I could go through orange then red to make it easier on the eyes).
2. I grey out any that are in pending status, as they are usually waiting response or site visit.

!image-2021-07-19-09-55-24-940.png!
fields.summary: Highlight rows based on SLA due date\time.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In rare circumstances the deletion of an object schema together with object creation can cause the deletion of the schema to fail and leaving some object types without attributes. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object schema with an object type and an object in it
 # Delete the schema
 # While the schema is deleting (after all objects are deleted) create a new object

h3. Expected Results

The object creation fails because the object schema is being deleted. 
h3. Actual Results

The schema deletion fails and standard attributes for an object type are deleted
h3. Workaround

Once happened delete the schema again.
fields.summary: Deleting an object schema in JSM Insight can cause a race condition

fields.description:
h3. *Current behavior*

When agents and admins are working on tickets and go to the Related articles and click on one of them, it opens a new tab to view the entire article.
h3. *Suggestion*

It would be great if, instead of being redirected to view the article on another tab, that the article opens on the sidebar, so agents can just check if it’s the desired article in order to share with the customer.
fields.summary: Ability to preview articles on the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, the picture from "Insight" dropdown are still visible for existing administrator that already aware about the Insight feature. Below are the image :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-16 at 2.05.14 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
It will be best for admin to have option to tick and remove the "How to get started" image and only see the "View all object schema" and the "Insight Configuration" link from the dropdown.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to remove the Insight "How to get started" image from the Insight drop down

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Customers are looking to take advantage of the features that the ITSM service project template has to offer and would like to be able to move existing projects and configurations to the new template.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to the ability to easily convert existing service projects to new ITSM Service Projects without having to go through recreating the project and new configurations.

h3. Workaround
[Can I move my existing project to the new ITSM template?|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/can-i-move-my-existing-project-to-the-new-itsm-template/]
fields.summary: Allow to the ability to easily convert existing service project to new ITSM Service Project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At team managed project template , when customers changes the issue request type that requires approval to a different request type that doesn't need approval , it causing the approval status remain at "Pending Approval". Due to that , it still listed in "Pending Approval" queue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue that require approval
 # Then , change the request type that don't require approval.

h3. Expected Results
Approvals will be remove and approval status no longer pending

h3. Actual Results
Approval status still remain pending and the issue display at "Pending Approval" queue


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Approval status remain "Pending Approval" once changing the request type from approval require request type to non require request type

fields.description:
It will be great if the width of the 'issue type' dropdown on the issue create screen to be increased to accommodate the customer request type names -- which is typically longer than the usual Jira issue type names.

Currently, the dropdown is too narrow to accommodate Customer Request Type names and  this makes it difficult for agents to create requests on behalf when the request type is cut off.

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-16 at 09.42.53.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Width of 'Issue Type' dropdown for Request Types on Issue Create Screen

fields.description: Possibility to create a postmortem Template in Opsgenie.
fields.summary: Opsgenie PostMortemTemplate

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In order for agents to have access to tickets, they need to be *licensed*, be added as a *request participant* or be a *member of an organization*. This, however, could be cumbersome to maintain or not as user-friendly as sending a link.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful to enable access to tickets through specific links. This way, the user would have access to interact with the *specific ticket* through a *specific link*, without the need to have specific permissions for the whole project.

h3. Workaround
* Give a *license* to the user.
* Add the user to the *request participants* of the ticket.
* Add the user to an *organization*.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict access to tickets through specific link

fields.description:
Actually, it is not possible to inactive Services on ITSM projects.

It would be useful to have this option since in some cases, users don't want to delete unused services to keep the history of the ticket.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to be able to inactivate Services on ITSM projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portal-only customers added to the Agent role of Team Managed projects (Next-Gen) cannot be deleted from the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Team Managed project
# Set the customer permission to be "Customer my team adds to the project"
# On the *Internal access* page, add a portal-only customer to the role of Agent/Admin. Note that the customer will not be visible on this page.
# Go back to the *Customers* page. 
# Notice that the customer will appear there. Try removing the customer from the list.

h3. Expected Results

The customer is removed.

h3. Actual Results

A success message shows up, the customer won't be removed from the page.

GIF: https://share.getcloudapp.com/QwuArw2p

h3.Workaround

Use the [DELETE project role actor|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-project-role-actors/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-role-id-delete] API.

{code}curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project/{projectIdOrKey}/role/{id}?user=5b10ac8d82e05b22cc7d4ef5' \
  --user 'email@example.com:<api_token>'{code}
fields.summary: Unable to delete customers from Team Managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Email requests failing with "There was an error reading the body of email message" randomly
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue is not consistent, so it can't be reproduced simply by sending an email request with attachments or any normal emails either.
h3. Expected Results

The email created a ticket in the project
h3. Actual Results

The email fails and we can see that it's marked as FAILED in the email audit logs
h3. Workaround

If you are using IMAP as the protocol, you can mark the failed email as unread so Jira Service Desk will reprocess it, the risk of failure still exists, though.
fields.summary: Email requests failing with "There was an error reading the body of email message"

fields.description:
The "Create with shared configuration" currently take over the following configurations when creating a new project:

Permission Scheme
Notification Scheme
Issue Security Scheme
Workflow Scheme
Issue Type Scheme
Issue Type Screen Scheme
Field Configuration Scheme
Request Types
SLAs 
Queues
Components
etc..

For Service Projects though it is very convenient to have the below implemented in this function as well:
*Portal settings*
*Customer notifications*
*Knowledge base*
etc...
fields.summary: Incorporate JSM Settings into the "create with shared configuration" option: Portal settings, Customer notifications, Knowledge base, etc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, as the request type form has the option to edit the field layout , admin would like to hide some field for the "Agent" view section. However, when the screen have multiple tab screen, admin unable to move field from "General" screen to the hidden section.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create screen with multiple tab
# Open the project
 # Go to *Request Type > Agent view*
# Move field from "General" section to hidden

h3. Expected Results
Able to move the field to hidden.

h3. Actual Results
Not able to move the field to hidden

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to move field to hidden if the screen have multiple tab screen at the "Request Type" screen for Agent view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL function currentUser() does not work when used with the Group HAVING IQL clause
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object with a User type attribute and a Group type attribute
 # Assign non-licensed users to an object
 # Add the same user to a Jira group and assign the same group as well to the object
 # Attempt to use the Filter scope IQL's as follow one by one:
{noformat}
"Owner" = currentUser()
AND 
"Group" HAVING user("currentUser()")
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

In both cases when the nonlicensed user tries to browse the objects, they get the objects assigned to them via the user attribute Or the group attribute
h3. Actual Results

The objects can be browsed by the user when using the user attribute in Filter scope IQL.
{noformat}
"Owner" = currentUser() {noformat}
But they can't be browsed when using the group attribute in Filter scope IQL even though the user belongs to the group assigned to the object:
{noformat}
 "Group" HAVING user("currentUser()")
{noformat}
It starts to work if you now provide this user with a Jira license.
h3. Workaround

Use the user type attribute if possible with cardinality set to unlimited Or if possible use the placeholders 
{noformat}
"Group" HAVING user(${reporter}) {noformat}
fields.summary: JQL function currentUser() does not work when used with the Group HAVING IQL clause

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When insight been inactive for more the 10 minutes it start to display "not authorised" messages and forces the user to refresh the page and loose current view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Load insight in a tab
 # Switch tab and wait more then 10 minutes
 # Navigate back to the insight tab and try do something

h3. Expected Results

The user after resuming to the insight tab should be able to continue the work in the current view. The token need to expire at some point but should be increased from 10 minutes.
h3. Actual Results

Error messages is displayed
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When being inactive for a short while "not authorised" is displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding customers when customer is already invited and signed up, do not receive invitation emails when added to organization in the same project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With Admin account, Click 'Add customers' and enter email and click 'Add'
 # Go to the inbox of the email and sign up by clicking on the signup link
 # With Admin account, Click 'Add organizations' and enter organization name and click 'Add'
 # With Admin account, Click on organization and click 'Add customers' and enter same email and click 'Add'

h3. Expected Results

Customer should receive an invitation email as noted on description.
 !image-2021-07-14-11-29-08-648.png|width=400!
h3. Actual Results
Customer only receives an invitation email only when the customer has not signed up yet via email signup link.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding customers on certain conditions do not receive invitation emails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When calling Jira to fetch users that is part of an objects history, Jira can then return 404 causing a NotFoundException to be thrown that is then wrapped into a ExecutionException.

The ExecutionException is not handled correctly, causing the history request to fail 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # You must first have access to an object with history that will make Jira return 404
 # Load the object history

h3. Expected Results

When the history endpoint is called the requested object history is returned
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the log:
{noformat}
Jira API returned a response with code: 404 (Not Found)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Fetching object history can cause a ExecutionException

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For an "IT service management (Essentials)" project, when the selected default request type for the widget includes the "Original Estimate" field, the widget settings page fails to load with a "We can't load the widget right now. Try again in a little while." error message due to the API call returning a 500 error.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Enable next gen projects by navigating to *<*_your site name*>.*_*atlassian.net/jsd-**next-gen*|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/get-the-team-managed-jira-service-management-experience/]
 # Create an "IT service management (Essentials)" project (open or private is fine)
 # Got to Project Settings -> Request Types -> Any request type
 # Add the "Original Estimate" field to the request type Context fields and save it
 # Go to Project Settings -> Channels -> Widget
 # Set the "Default request type" to the request type you edited in step 4 and save the widget

h3. Expected Results

The widget page loads.
h3. Actual Results

The API request to {{[https://jsd-widget-prod.atlassian.com/api/settings/embeddable?projectId=]<project-id>}} will fail with a 500 response and the body
{code:java}
{
  "friendlyReason": {
    "title": "Something went wrong",
    "body": "Please try again in a little while."
  },
  "technicalReason": null
}
{code}
The stack trace in the logs will be similar to

 
{code:java}
 java.lang.NullPointerException: Right parameter must not be null.
	at java.util.Objects.requireNonNull(Objects.java:228)
	at io.atlassian.fugue.Pair.<init>(Pair.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.fields.FieldValidator.lambda$validateValuesUnfiltered$3(FieldValidator.java:63)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.stream.DistinctOps$1$2.accept(DistinctOps.java:175)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175)
	at java.util.Spliterators$ArraySpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:948)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:482)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:472)
	at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708)
	at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234)
	at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:566)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.fields.FieldValidator.validateValuesUnfiltered(FieldValidator.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.precondition.FieldMissingOrBrokenValuePrecondition.validateRequestTypeFields(FieldMissingOrBrokenValuePrecondition.java:305)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.precondition.FieldMissingOrBrokenValuePrecondition.lambda$internalValidate$6(FieldMissingOrBrokenValuePrecondition.java:192)
{code}
 
h3. Workaround

Remove "Original Estimate" field from the request type.
fields.summary: Including "Original Estimate" as a field on a request type in a JSM Essentials Project breaks the widget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a series in a report, if the user hovers over the box showing the request type for a moment and then continues with keyboard input, the box will persist until a page refresh.

*Note:* this behavior also happens for other JQL fields, such as SLA goals and Legacy Automation "Issue matches" conditions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or go to a report
 # Edit a series
# Type in a request type
# Hover over the dropdown for a moment
# Hover over the box for a moment
# Begin to type (e.g., use backspace)
# Observe the box persists until refreshing the page

h3. Expected Results
The box goes away when not being hovered over.

h3. Actual Results
The box persists until a page refresh.

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page after saving any needed changes.
fields.summary: When typing on a JQL field, suggestion boxes persist (even into other pages) until refreshing the page

fields.description: To export to confluence, you have to search for the space each time. It would be nice to keep a list of the most recent ones used here to save some time.
fields.summary: Postmortem to confluence UI could populate recently used spaces / pages for ease of use

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, when customer are created via automation , it doesn't send invitation email even though the customer notification for customer invite are enabled.

h3. Suggestion
Send invitation email to customer when account created via automation.

h3. Workaround
Trigger "Send Email" action after the "Add service project customer*.
fields.summary: Allow "Add service project customer" action to send invitation email once customer invited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we merge the JSM and standalone Opsgenie the default access group *opsgenie-users* from the site.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a site with standalone Opsgenie and standalone JSM subscriptions
 # Merge JSM and Opsgenie from the UI
 # Check the product access page
 # You will be *opsgenie-users* group added to the Jira Service Management 
!Screenshot 2021-07-12 at 8.08.58 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The default access group is deleted/removed
h3. Actual Results

The default access group is added under Product access for JSM
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Merging JSM and standalone Opsgenie doesn't remove the default access group.

fields.description: When a user types some something in summary field while creating a ticket in the customer portal, it should have capabilities to show earlier searched words by the user as suggestions for that field
fields.summary: Show the previous entered data in Summary field in the customer portal

fields.description:
Sometimes, the Opsgenie instance may have suspended users to meet the maximum amount of users per subscription plan, but it only reflects the currently active users during the migration to JSM.

For example, as the screenshot below, this Opsgenie instance had 8 users during the free trial but downsized to 5 after the expiry of the trial to meet the Free subscription plan, meanwhile, there are 24 JSM users.

But during the migration process, the page only shows you have 5 users instead of 8 and 24 JSM users, so the new total users licenses after merged will be 32, which is confusing.

!image-2021-07-12-15-03-38-388.png|width=280,height=183!

This needs to be improved.

Thanks.
fields.summary: The total amount of Opsgenie users should also include the suspended ones during migration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

Currently, we don't have any access to audit logs for Insight.
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be great to provide Audit logs for Insight to track the user's activity. The audit log should also include deletion of objects, object attributes, object types and object schema.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Audit Logs for insight

fields.description:
Problem :
In the new ITSM project template Raise a Request button not available. Customer mentioned that  they have a lot of custom fields for the Service Request issue type. These fields are only relevant depending on which Request Type is selected but when you use the Create button you see every field even though you only select one request type.



Suggested solution :
*Raise a request* feature include fields in the Customer Portal however the create button include the fields in the create issue screen.Hence it is important for customers to have this button
fields.summary: Raise a Request button not available in ITSM service Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary
Currently, the "Last seen on" date accounts for licensed users accessing Jira. Many users with site-only access & no product access use the JSM portal to create/update the tickets.
Therefore, without the "Last seen on" activity for these users, it is difficult for admins to track their activity

h3. Suggestion Solution

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The SLA trigger can often timeout when performing a JQL query to see which issues had past the given threshold. This prints the error SocketException: Socket closed to the audit log.

* Current implementation relies on polling - product teams should look at using native events instead to improve reliability
* Attempting to retry queries in the case of timeout to minimise errors might be a short term option

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that the test site has a lot of data/issues/projects
 # Configure an automation rule with a SLA threshold breached trigger - allow the rule to run
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-24 at 11.59.52 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Rule runs without issues

h3. Actual Results
* Rule randomly fails with "SocketException: Socket closed"(or similar) message
* The rule query fails due to timeout

h3. Workaround
* Use the legacy automation rules - "SLA time remaining" trigger can be used:
 !Screenshot 2021-07-08 at 11.25.06.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL query in SLA threshold breached trigger can often timeout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Confluence article ID is too large it is represented incorrectly in the frontend so the links don't work. The cause is that the frontend is storing the {{articleId}} as a string and then converting it to a number, which in Javascript is stored as a double-precision floating-point, so large IDs (greater than [MAX_SAFE_INTEGER|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number/MAX_SAFE_INTEGER] - 9007199254740991) begin to be affected by the limitations of floating point precision.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create enough confluence articles such that the article ID is 9007199254740993 (or higher)

h3. Expected Results

The link to KB article with ID 9007199254740993 from the Portal should have the ID as 9007199254740993
h3. Actual Results

The link to KB article with ID 9007199254740993 from the Portal is 9007199254740992

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening KB articles from JSM fails to find articles when the ID is too large

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A race condition with multiple rules triggered SLA breach across Legacy Automation and A4J leads to the SLA rule being executed twice. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Since it's a race condition, it's not possible to consistently reproduce this. It may be reproducible if multiple rules are set up across Legacy Automation and A4J to trigger on "SLA Breach" events that lead to issue changes.

It might also be worth investigating to see if multiple legacy automation rules could cause this as the support investigation was not able to determine exactly which issue change event lead to the race condition.
h3. Expected Results

The rule executes once. 
h3. Actual Results

The rule is executed multiple times. 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

This can be avoided if a single rule is set up as that would mean there wouldn't be parallel issue change actions happening.
fields.summary: Legacy automation rule SLA breached triggers twice

fields.description:
Send Webhook request allows smart values for Webhook URL.

Microsoft Teams and Slack both do not allow smart values.

*How to reproduce*

Create new rule:
 # When: Scheduled: Advanced Cron: 0 0 0 1 1 ? 1970
 # Then: Create variable:
 ## Variable name: url
 ## Smart value: https://<tenancy name>.webhook.office.com/webhookb2/<channel GUID>/IncomingWebhook/<webhook GUID>
 # And: Send Microsoft Teams message:
 ## Webhook URL: \{{ url}}
 ## Message title: Test notification
 ## Message: This is a test notification
 ## Include summary in message

Publish rule

*Expected behaviour*

Rule published; can execute with "Run Now".

*Actual behaviour*

Rule does not publish: an alert is registered against "Webhook URL" field in "Send Microsoft Teams message" action

*Impact*

Low; can be worked around with reasonable difficulty. The main reason for this is to simplify rule management, and to allow the webhook URL to be extracted from other sources, eg. an Insight object attribute or an Issue entity property.

*Workaround*

Send an outgoing webhook instead:
 # Webhook URL: \{{ url}}
 # Headers: Content-Type: application/json
 # HTTP method: POST
 # Webhook body: custom data
 # Custom data:

{noformat}
{
	"summary": "{{issue.key}} {{issue.summary.jsonEncode}}",
	"sections": [
		{
			"activityTitle": "{{issue.VIP}}{{#if(exists(issue.priority))}} 👆 {{issue.priority.name.jsonEncode}}{{/}} ⏰ {{issue.Time to Resolution.ongoingCycle.remainingTime.friendly.jsonEncode}} 👩‍💼 {{reporter.displayName.jsonEncode}}{{#if(exists(issue.Affected Services))}} ⚙ {{issue.affectedServices.name.join(",").jsonEncode}}{{/}}",
			"activitySubtitle": "",
			"activityImage": "https://d283vu6e5qi87p.cloudfront.net/automation/prod/automation-logo.svg",
			"activityText": "* Assigned by: {{initiator.displayName.jsonEncode}}\n* Reporter: {{issue.reporter.displayName.jsonEncode}}{{#if(exists(issue.Affected Contact))}}\n* Affected Contact: {{issue.Affected Contact.displayName.jsonEncode}}{{/}}{{#if(exists(issue.Affected Services))}}\n* Affected Services: {{issue.affectedServices.name.join(",").jsonEncode}}{{/}}"
		},
		{
			"activityTitle": "{{issue.key}} {{issue.summary.jsonEncode}}",
			"facts": [
				{
					"name": "Status",
					"value": "{{issue.status.jsonEncode}}"
				},
				{
					"name": "Issue type",
					"value": "{{issue.issuetype.name.jsonEncode}}"
				},
				{
					"name": "Assignee",
					"value": "{{#if(exists(issue.assignee))}}{{issue.assignee.name.jsonEncode}}{{/}}{{#if(not(exists(issue.assignee)))}}Unassigned{{/}}"
				}
			]
		}
	],
	"potentialAction": [],
	"themeColor": "fd5a00",
	"@context": "http://schema.org/extensions",
	"@type": "MessageCard"
}
{noformat}
The Slack action further validates that the webhook URL is for the Slack domain, not useful if users want to use a middle layer application to collect these notifications. The same workaround is available for Slack.
fields.summary: Allow smart values for webhook URL in Microsoft Teams, Slack message actions

!image-2021-06-23-14-04-29-926.png!

fields.description:
Currently, the "Team" field can be added to issue types in Jira Service Desk but cannot be used since it requires Plans. Those, in turn, are tied to Advanced Roadmaps which are not applicable to Service Desk.

Removing the above constraint in Service Desk would allow the "Team" field to be used in the tickets. At any given time it should either be empty or hold a single value for the Team that is currently handling it.

Justification:

In a Service Desk, multiple teams can be involved in handling a ticket. The "Team" field would be helpful to hand off tickets from one team to another at a Team level. The new team can then assign it to a specific team member. It is very challenging in large organizations to track specific assignees whereas it is much easier to determine a team for the hand-off.

This change would also allow queues to be set up more easily by team, and track how long it takes for a specific team member to be assigned to an issue once it has been handed off to another team.
fields.summary: Allow the "Team" field to be used in Service Desk issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a distribution list is added as a request participant, and the members of the distribution list reply to the email notification from Jira Service Management, a new request is created because the sender doesn't have permission to comment on the request they are replying to.

It is possible to use Jira automation to add an organization if a specific request participant is added to a request but if multiple request participants belong to different organizations are added at the same time, automation rules cannot be used.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow automation to be able to identify the organization of request participants and add the organization(s) to the Organizations field.

h3. Workaround
Create an organization with the same members as the distribution list and share the request with the organization.
fields.summary: Allow automation rules to identify organizations that request participants are in
